byline.contributor: Isabel Kershner contributed reporting from Jerusalem, Helene Cooper from Washington, and Michael S. Schmidt from Norfolk, Va.

lead_paragraph: President Obama is looking past his time in office and weighing a plan that would preserve at least the principle of a two-state solution for his successor to pursue.

headline.print_headline: Obama Seeks a Way to Save Mideast Goals
headline.main: Obama Seeks to Pave Way to Mideast Deal After He Leaves Office

snippet: President Obama is looking past his time in office and weighing a plan that would preserve at least the principle of a two-state solution for his successor to pursue.
abstract: Pres Obama, resigned to his failure to negotiate peace deal between Israelis and Palestinians during his time in office, is examining ways to preserve meager gains and provide his successor with framework for two-state solution; deliberations have rankled Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu, who has fraught relationship with Obama.
